name: SnapshotTableRequest
title: Google
Bigtable
Admin
V2
SnapshotTableRequest
description:
Request message for Google::Bigtable::Admin::V2::BigtableTableAdmin::SnapshotTable

Note: This is a private alpha release of Cloud Bigtable snapshots. This feature is not currently available to most Cloud Bigtable customers. This feature might be changed in backward-incompatible ways and is not recommended for production use. It is not subject to any SLA or deprecation policy.

returns.description:
The unique name of the table to have the snapshot taken.
Values are of the form
+projects/<project>/instances/<instance>/tables/<table>+.</instance></project>

The unique name of the table to have the snapshot taken.
Values are of the form
+projects/<project>/instances/<instance>/tables/<table>+.</instance></project>

The name of the cluster where the snapshot will be created in.
Values are of the form
+projects/<project>/instances/<instance>/clusters/<cluster>+.</cluster></instance></project>

The name of the cluster where the snapshot will be created in.
Values are of the form
+projects/<project>/instances/<instance>/clusters/<cluster>+.</cluster></instance></project>

The ID by which the new snapshot should be referred to within the parent cluster, e.g., +mysnapshot+ of the form: +[a-zA-Z0-9][-.a-zA-Z0-9]*+ rather than +projects//instances//clusters//snapshots/mysnapshot+.

The ID by which the new snapshot should be referred to within the parent cluster, e.g., +mysnapshot+ of the form: +[a-zA-Z0-9][-.a-zA-Z0-9]*+ rather than +projects//instances//clusters//snapshots/mysnapshot+.

The amount of time that the new snapshot can stay active after it is
created. Once ‘ttl’ expires, the snapshot will get deleted. The maximum
amount of time a snapshot can stay active is 7 days. If ‘ttl’ is not
specified, the default value of 24 hours will be used.

The amount of time that the new snapshot can stay active after it is
created. Once ‘ttl’ expires, the snapshot will get deleted. The maximum
amount of time a snapshot can stay active is 7 days. If ‘ttl’ is not
specified, the default value of 24 hours will be used.
